headline.main: US Police Agencies With Their Own DNA Databases Stir Debate
headline.print_headline: US Police Agencies With Their Own DNA Databases Stir Debate

lead_paragraph: Dozens of police departments around the U.S. are amassing their own DNA databases to track criminals, a move critics say is a way around regulations governing state and national databases that restrict who can provide genetic samples and how long that information is held.
